page.title: 13MOTORWAY 1
page.content: "M1"STANDS FOR MOTORWAY ONE.IT RUNS FROM LONDON TO LEEDS.IT CARRIES ROUGHLY TWENTY-FIVE MILLION VEHICLES A YEAR.ON AVERAGE THE MIDDLE LANE IS USED MOST BECAUSE MOST VEHICLES TRAVEL ON THE MIDDLE LANE.NEXT TO THE OUTSIDE LANE THERE IS A HARD SHOULDER,THIS IS ON BOTH SIDES OF THE MOTORWAY.IF YOUR VEHICLE IS BADLY DAMAGED,YOU PULL OVER TO THE HARD SHOULDER.SOMEWHERE ALONG THE HARD SHOULDER AT INTERVALS ARE A.A. TELEPHONES.ALSO ALONG THE MOTORWAY ARE SERVICE STATIONS.SOMETIMES (NEARLY ALWAYS)THERE ARE CRASHES ALONG THE MOTORWAY,AND THERE ARE VERY LONG TRAFFIC JAMS.THEN THE HARD SHOULDER IS USED AS A WAY THROUGH FOR VEHICLES OR FOR AMBULANCES,FIRE ENGINES,POLICE CARS AND THE A.A. THE MOTORWAY IS USUALLY PACKED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE RUSH HOUR. BY ANDREW TURVEY
